website_summaries.verdict: Solid choice if you’re looking for a quiet, corded dog nail grinder. Great for smaller breeds, but grinding thicker nails can take some time.
pros: Quiet operation is ideal for nervous dogs
Lightweight design with a generous cord is comfortable to handle
Grinder attachments are easy to change
cons: Some owners felt it was a bit underpowered for large breeds with thick nails

customer_reviews.title: Depends on if you’re a groomer or pet owner on its rating
customer_reviews.text: Two reviews: Two views: I groom dogs for a living review: For smaller sized dogs with thinner nails it is good but slow sanding it’s quite also. Talking ShihTzu size and smaller. Large dogs or dogs with thicker fatter nails -nope nop nope- you will be sanding all day and most dogs wont go for that. Dog owner review- pretty safe, safe speed for home use and same as above good for smaller size dogs but not for large breed large nail dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Carb8

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely awful. I assumed the first one I got was faulty as despite following the instructions TO THE LETTER and having TWO other people attempt it, the collet nut will not loosen no matter what we do, and then the button sticks permanently. I ordered a replacement and had the EXACT same issue. I don't know if I got two from a faulty batch, but I don't think I'll ever be buying pet products from conair ever again. I have never had this kind of issue with any other dremel. I was really excited to use this because of the great reviews, but it's just a MASSIVE disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Nix

customer_reviews.title: Does a Great Job
customer_reviews.text: Used on two dogs (a Pug and a Cavalier KC) twice. Can't speak to reliability as yet, but this grinder works well. It is significantly quieter than the cheap battery powered one we used to have and is well tolerated by our boys. The old grinder bogged down, but this one has tons of power (care is needed to prevent overheating the claw--a light touch is called for). Chose this one over others because of the included hood which does a good job of collecting the dust.
customer_reviews.author: GKS

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I have a golden retriever who has always hated having her feet fiddled with and nails trimmed. After reading many reviews, I opted for this model because it is corded, and therefore I won't have to worry about all the bad reviews for battery-powered grinders that don't keep a charge. I especially like that this has an adjustable opening to keep from touching the grinder or getting hair caught. I just received it and gave it a try. Used a few treats along the way. She just sat there and let me use the grinder on her. It was a perfect experience. This grinder is very quiet and works well. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: RJaff

customer_reviews.title: Impressive!
customer_reviews.text: Tired of battery operated versions of this pet nail grooming, I thought I would try one that is totally electric. This works fantastic! Does a super job of trimming my dog's nails. Slightly louder than battery type, the dog still didn't mind it. I will never buy a rechargeable nail trimmer again as long as they keep making this Conair product!
customer_reviews.author: S. Guy

customer_reviews.title: Very Quiet
customer_reviews.text: Great Product. Dog much calmer with this over a dremel. It is smooth & quiet and I would highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dogs are afraid of this
customer_reviews.text: I have tried multiple time to get my dogs to use this product. They are a Doberman pinscher and a mini pinscher. Both of them have bitten me where blood has been drawn on myself. They haven bitten, scratched, tried chewing on the spinning drill. I can’t get them to use a manual nail trimmer either. When I took the bigger one to PetSmart for a nail grind. I thought he would have no sharp edges but it was apparent they could barely get him under control themselves. He is a rescue but my little one is onlyb6 months old. Even using winter gloves offers little protection. The idea is excellent. I wish there was a silent version.
customer_reviews.author: Chriss Lyon

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for dogs with thick nails.
customer_reviews.text: I have German Shepherd dogs and this file was not suitable for trimming their nails. The file grit is not course enough to trim their nails without it taking forever. Possibly would be good for use on a small dog or puppies. I did love that it had the protective guard to ensure against hitting the dogs quick. I ended up returning it to purchase a dremmel.
customer_reviews.author: Chrisitne M

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: Worked good. Very quite and easy to use. RPM will slow down if pressed to hard on large nails which is what I would expect. Choose grit according to nail size. I think any dremel tool bit will work but have not tried. Since I did three dogs, I got my moneys worth on first use.
customer_reviews.author: W. Doty

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: I have a chihuahua and retriever. Both hate getting their nails trimmed. This purchase was a last ditch effort because their nails were getting so long that I knew they were uncomfortable. I’m so glad I bought this because it is the first thing I’ve tried that they don’t try to run from or yelp when I do their nails. Like the other reviewers said, if their nails are very overgrown, you will likely need to do this in multiple sessions to get the length back to normal. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: The Chic Savvy Life

customer_reviews.title: Nice dremel for dog nails.
customer_reviews.text: This grinder is very easy to use. I take the cap off bc it’s in the way. I was not happy that the sandpaper replacement did not fit in the dremel(would not tighten) and the screw did not work with the screwdriver that was provided. Luckily I didn’t throw the other parts to my broken one away. I know how to replace the replacements on these bc I’ve been a groomer for 10 years and we previously had this one at my work. Other than that, it’s an good one to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: This does not automatically turn off if it gets caught in the dogs hair. It got caught in my 5 pound Maltese, tail, and it broke her tail because I couldn’t get it to turn off fast enough. I worked good except for that. I would not recommend this product, mine is going in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Vaughn

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the investment
customer_reviews.text: I've had several dremels over the years, most had the rechargeable battery that never worked out well long term. I thought this would be a great time to try the Conair model. It has a cord, so no charging! It came with a fancy guard, so no worries about wrapping up any chest fluff by accident. The grinding bands constantly slide up and down on the dremel while in use. This is incredibly frustrating as I'm constantly trying to fix this issue while using it. I've still been able to use the device, however it is less than ideal.
customer_reviews.author: Film Girl

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and it doesn’t terrify my dogs!
customer_reviews.text: This nail grinder arrived quickly after I ordered it. I was worried about the noise level of the grinder, as I had never purchased one that plugged into an outlet before. But, it’s quieter than the SLIGHTLY cheaper battery-powered version I had. The dog I always had to take into the vet to get her nails clipped, because she’s terrified of the other grinder’s loud sound and weaker file, is completely fine with this grinder! I love that the grinder has an easy to adjust hole for the claws to fit in to. I can rotate the plastic cover between nails and have each one turn out to be perfectly trimmed. This was an excellent purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ericka

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work. Tried and tried but didn't shave anything off any of my dogs nails. I used to shave my dogs nails with a dremel brand and it worked but I don't know what happened to it so ordered this and very unhappy
customer_reviews.author: Julie V.

customer_reviews.title: A good compromise for power and safety
customer_reviews.text: I have tried conventional battery powered and USB rechargeable nail grinders and found this AC powered model to be far superior. I have also used a Dremel-type tool and found this to be an improvement in that it includes a guard for the rotating cylinder. Its not perfect, but it is the best compromise found to date...
customer_reviews.author: Longhorn7175

customer_reviews.title: Not great, but best option?
customer_reviews.text: It's not AMAZING, but it works enough on a LARGE dog with thick nails. You probably shouldn't try to grind them down without clipping them as much as you can FIRST. I am not sure but my dog seems to find it uncomfortable, so I try to clip as much then file down to perfection. Comes we with different files from rough to smooth. All in all, best option I saw on Amazon even despite the need for clipping first.
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Quick
customer_reviews.text: Grinds so much quicker and smoother than a battery operated one. This one does not bother my dog.
customer_reviews.author: Tereasa M. Cagley

customer_reviews.title: Less scary for puppy!
customer_reviews.text: Used to take our puppy to a big box store to get his nails trimmed. He was not happy by the end. Decided to pick this up and try it ourselves. So much better! He sits there & hands us his paws & has no issue with the sound or the grinding.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Good tool. Attachments are better than what comes installed though
customer_reviews.text: This grinder is gold. Literally. However, the first thing you should do when you buy it is throw the pink grinding stone in the trash and put on one of the fine sanding drums. It's not a dremel but it doesn't cost as much as one either. We do like others have mentioned and clip then smooth. For that it works amazing. Not sure you'd want to just grind them unless you did it every week. Who has time for that! It's a good tool to add to your arsenal of animal care items. It's also very quiet. It takes me less than 10 minutes to do 2 dogs. Just throw the grinding stone where it belongs. In the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm thankful for this product
customer_reviews.text: I have four dogs and I've tried other nail clippers and grinders with awful results; from bleeding to not grinding at all, to spending hours just to be done. I bought this grinder and omg I spend 10 to 20 minutes on four dogs depending how much they move that day. Is easy to use after you read the instructions, it eliminated the accidental cuts and is has definitely made my life easier and my pets happier about nail trimming time.
customer_reviews.author: A.Wes

customer_reviews.title: but it is better than not having one at all
customer_reviews.text: My basset hound's nails are thick, and trimmers with batteries always ran out halfway through. The cord is long and I have no issue using this corded. The cover doesn't prevent as much dust spraying everywhere as I was hoping, but it is better than not having one at all. Overall I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: V. Hagan

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I've had the cordless kind of nail dremel for the dogs before and the batteries die before I get done. Never again do I need to worry about batteries! Nice, long cord on this with multiple heads - some for heavier grinding and some more for polishing. Super easy to change the grinder head and I like the fact that it has a guard on it. My only critique is I wish it had multiple speeds vs just on/off, but overall very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: MJN

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Use this on three pugs. It gets hot pretty fast. It takes getting used to holding when using. It’s awkward at first and just one speed but it gets the job done. Best thing is the fact that it is powered by plugging into outlet vs batteries. Used ferminator Dremel for years was good but ate batteries. Read the instructions. It’s tricky to change heads and install so save annoyance.
customer_reviews.author: Pug Poppy

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this dremel
customer_reviews.text: I like that this model plugs into the wall since so many reviews of the battery-operated ones complain about not having enough power. It's not too noisy. My dog wasn't crazy about it, but she was ok, and I'm sure she'll be more relaxed next time. I found that it worked a lot better and a lot faster when I took the protective cover off.
customer_reviews.author: cryogini

customer_reviews.title: Incredible!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice!! I have two mini american Eskimos, 8 and 12lbs. They absolutely HATE having their nails trimmed. They were still A little spooked at first by the noise but settled right down once they got used to it and realized it didn't hurt. So glad none of us have to dread paw time ever again, I am one happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I like this product because it does the job of trimming the nails of my German Shepard dog. It’s easy to use. My dog doesn’t feel anything when I’m trimming her nails.
customer_reviews.author: Jie

customer_reviews.title: safe and easy. a bit noisy and startling for pup
customer_reviews.text: my dog doesn’t love the thing, but i feel way better about cutting his nails now. It was pain free for both of us & very easy. It took a little longer than clippers might, but i never worried about hurting him and that’s what I really wanted from this
customer_reviews.author: Bran

customer_reviews.title: Cheap. 1 Year use or Less.
customer_reviews.text: Plastic inside broke after a year use of changing bits. I opened up to try to repair but every peice of plastic started to deteriorate. This small issue prevents problems with changing the bits, unlocking and locking colet and nut assembly. I'd request a refund, but, little chance of companies these days to take responsibility and upgrade their customer service. Recommend just purchasing a dremel from a tool shop and bits for dog nails as well as shop work at home.
customer_reviews.author: Zillybears

customer_reviews.title: Not very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: Not a very comfortable tool at all. It has only one speed and not very easy to hold in hands. It has only one speed. My dog has pretty thick nails and this tool is not doing a very good job.
customer_reviews.author: Viktor

customer_reviews.title: Game changer!
customer_reviews.text: The perfect addition to the ConairPRO Nail Grinder. The grinding stone that comes with the unit is great for polishing and finishing, but for my large dog's nails, this was a game changer to get the length down. This should be included with the unit or they should make a separate unit for large dogs that includes this.
customer_reviews.author: Sinnickel

customer_reviews.title: I love it and my dog loves it too.
customer_reviews.text: I rubbed this item on my face and my arms to show my puppy dog there wasn't anything to be afraid of and then I rubbed it all over him and he became comfortable. This is the best way 2 cut your puppy's nails by far. I had a problem exchanging drill bits and my brother figured it out. I'm glad I have it.
customer_reviews.author: Constance

customer_reviews.title: Cuts SOOO SLOW!!
customer_reviews.text: The product is pretty noisy, it is hard to maneuver, and the biggest problem I had was how slowly it cuts. I worked on one of my dogs nails for several minutes before she got sick of it and ran off. When I recaught her I noticed the nail I had been working on was barely filed down. I ended up getting rid of this one and buying a furminator brand that works great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It has a lot of power and interchangeable grinding heads.
customer_reviews.text: I tried the rechargeable cheap nail grinder first and was really disapointed. It had no power at all. It would have taken hours to do my dogs nails. I have a Silky Yorkie and he does not have tough nails. So I retuned that one and bought this instead and wow what a difference. This thing has power and interchangable grinding heads. It comes with smooth and course grinders. Big difference is it is corded so it has alot of power. I did all of his nails in about 10 minutes. It is also very quit for how much power it has. Very nice unit!!!
customer_reviews.author: Cletis Bevis

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, depending on the size of your dog
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my Papillon puppy's nails I have an actual Dremel brand tool which I use to grind the nails of my two Labradors and LOVE that tool for them, however the Dremel was too high powered and loud for the puppy. This Conair grinder works great for the Papillon so I am pleased with the purchase (have used it a couple of months so far). I would recommend this grinder for a small dog only however as it would take forever to grind my Labs nails using this grinder and they would probably lose patience (as would I).
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl L. MatthewsTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: ineffective
customer_reviews.text: It is relatively quiet, but it hardly made any difference on my dog's nails. I have a brittany spaniel (a medium sized dog). I can see that it would be used for smoothing the edges of her nails maybe, but it was not useful in trimming them. She's pretty good about sitting nicely to have her nails done, but we would've been there all day waiting for this thing to finally get them short enough.
customer_reviews.author: Apri

customer_reviews.title: One of the best options I’ve found
customer_reviews.text: I got this one since I needed something fast for my dog who hates nail trimming, the files work fine, wish it had little more power but at least gets the job done faster than the common grinders
customer_reviews.author: Linn

customer_reviews.title: Can't change the file attachments - Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Quiet and runs great. But the mechanism inside that locks the rotation for you to change the attachments does not work. So basically, you can use the file that shipped on it and when it's worn out, the whole thing will need to be disposed of. Very disappointed. Too expensive to toss after just one file attachment. Contacted Amazon and they are shipping a replacement...we'll see how it goes.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Perfect grinder for Large dogs
customer_reviews.text: Searched for that perfect or workable grinder for large dogs with very thick nails. This is really a great investment. Have used on Shepherds and have cut my time in half. Very pleased with this grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I really like that this little sander is electric and not battery. I also was able to take of the attachment and just run the grinder without it. It really works great! I am able to grind down all my dogs nails and not hurt them. You can buy different attachments--but I am mostly interested in grinding down my dogs nails.
customer_reviews.author: M. Beverly Nash

customer_reviews.title: My Dog Loves  this grinder
customer_reviews.text: Works great! It’s quite with a strong motor. My pedi paw broke so I bought this one hoping it would be better and boy is it ever! It just tool a few minutes to grind down all my dogs nails. He’s a pretty good size dog weighting around 65lbs..
customer_reviews.author: deavamarie

customer_reviews.title: Dog comfortable with it
customer_reviews.text: Of all the ones I tried to trim my dog's nails, this is by far the best and he feels comfortable with it, not scared. Just wish I could maneuver a little better around his little paws with the guard on but he's tiny so I understand the limitations. But it works for us.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Eng

customer_reviews.title: Not for professional groomers
customer_reviews.text: Used this nail for the first time on a GS that only needed a little off her nails. I used it for 2 minutes on one na and still was no where close to the desired length. In that 2 minutes the nail got so hot that I couldn't continue using it even if it was efficient.
customer_reviews.author: Josie

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: These files fit a nail sander that we purchased for our 50 pound dog (English Bull Terrier) - she has nails that are too large and hard to use clippers so we use the sander. These replacement wheels have more grit than the ones that came with our sander so it makes very quick work for us. I would order these again.
customer_reviews.author: Jacquie Groves

customer_reviews.title: Very noisey but does a great job
customer_reviews.text: Somewhere either in reviews or the description it said how quiet this unit is, well that is a lie. The battery operated units I have used are much quieter. This definitely works better than the battery units, so it gets 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Mom2minpins

customer_reviews.title: Efficient and No Batteries Needed!
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace the pedipaw. The sandpaper head shortens my greyhounds nails really fast, takes about 20-30 min. The pedipaw took about 3 hours to do her nails. This little thing is so efficient. Love that it doesnt require batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby

customer_reviews.title: DID NOT  function as advertised.  Waste of money .
customer_reviews.text: Very difficult to use and far too strong vibration for my hearty, older lab. If it’s not too late I will return it for a refund. back to clipping them manually. Disappointed and annoyed that I spent that much money on something useless.
customer_reviews.author: M R.

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my decision!! 5 stars!
customer_reviews.text: This review may be premature, but we used this for the first time and it went great. It is not too loud for our 17 week old puppy and it grinded great! Due to the cord, we don't have to worry about the battery slowing the motor down, which should keep the same great results for a long time. Our puppy has groomed nails and it did not take too long to accomplish. This is a great alternative to clipping, no stress involved, we are incredibly happy with our purchase! I researched all of the other grinders and I'm very happy I went with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: This works very well on both of our dogs, one is a small terrier mix and the other is a large doodle. Both have their dew claws and this grinder is quiet and is easy to maneuver. Works great and our dogs tolerate it nicely.
customer_reviews.author: J. R.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves it. Hard to believe. Love the cord. Allows the power to be steady and sure. Beats a battery. Maneuverability is great. Great buy
customer_reviews.author: Laddie

customer_reviews.title: You need to know how to use it!
customer_reviews.text: You need to know how to handle this because it is not as easy as you think. What I like is that is electrical and the cord is long enough. The power of the motor could be stronger or faster... overall it works so far.
customer_reviews.author: Alice

customer_reviews.title: Too slow for a large size dog
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 pitbulls that don't like their nails trimmed. The noise is low, so it does not scare the dogs. However, it takes forever to file the nails down. I rather pay to have them done, than to use this. I would not recommend if your dog has thick nails. But if it's a smaller size dog, this will work great on them.
customer_reviews.author: maria

customer_reviews.title: Does not work!
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed. I needed a good nail trimmer for my 16 pound dog. This does not trim my dog’s nails. I have an Oster nail trimmer that does not work. I ordered the Conair based on reviews. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty

customer_reviews.title: Runs quite and better on nervous dogs.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great with my 3 year old labradoodle. He is a little sensitive about toenail trimming but worked great. Relatively fast with a grinding/sanding of toenail was more calming then a nail cut which made him nervous maybe from the snap sound and presser. Either way much better now, good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: James Sanscrainte

customer_reviews.title: Great for dogs
customer_reviews.text: This is now my 3rd dremel for my dogs. This one by far works the best. The other 2 were so loud that my dogs would freak out. There is some noise but not bothersome to my dogs, and it files their nails. So yes this is a keeper, thanks
customer_reviews.author: annabell

customer_reviews.title: Works fine. Needs a higher speed.
customer_reviews.text: A little underpowered but still works fine. All seam to be this way. Like the included gaurd a lot. Wish it had a light though, and two speeds. Comes with extra sanding drums and two style of stones for finishing. I have a Corgi and a Doxin/Collie mix.
customer_reviews.author: alex gordon

customer_reviews.title: Best of all the clear plastic "guard" holds nail debris ...
customer_reviews.text: NO FEAR.... Q U I E T.... I owned the dremel battery operated unit. LOUD. Scared my dogs. Plus battery failed. This is a keep. Best of all the clear plastic "guard" holds nail debris inside. Clean quiet powerful. No issues..
customer_reviews.author: P. Nash

customer_reviews.title: About the pet nail grinder
customer_reviews.text: It stop working after 5 times useing the darn thing very disappointing I would like another one if the seller would sell it to me for half price

customer_reviews.title: Worth buying
customer_reviews.text: Awesome device! Did great with both of my dogs, they weren’t skittish and sat through the whole trimming.
customer_reviews.author: jp

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: My chihuahua is terrified of this. The husky is less afraid . It does work though. Takes time so if your dog has long/really thick nails try trimming first and then using this to sand them down
customer_reviews.author: medina

customer_reviews.title: Course stone worked the best for me
customer_reviews.text: Freaked the dogs out a bit when I started using it. I found it more effective with the guard removed because it doesn't work so well on small dog nails just because the guard was not allowing the nail to enter far enough. Course stone worked the best for me. Expect a strong smell and lots of dust. I suggest a dust mask and outdoor use. Four stars because it works well as advertised despite the slight learning curve for both operator and dog.
customer_reviews.author: brotherspartan

customer_reviews.title: Nail
customer_reviews.text: There isn't a guard for how much of the nail should be clipped. Very dangerous. Also the noise scares my dog.
customer_reviews.author: Keith A. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Switched to this plug in nail grinder after replacing multiple battery powered hand held nail grinders that couldnt keep their charge. This thing is amazing, steady speed, easy to use, and makes grooming day a breeze. Would highly recommend! For reference i have a 30 lbs puggle and a 75 lbs lab and it works wondefully on both.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I’m so glad I went ti this “industrial “ size nail grinder. I have a Pit with very thick hard nails and nothing else was strong enough. The noise level is very low so it doesn’t scare my boy.
customer_reviews.author: Kathie Krieger

customer_reviews.title: Once the dog got used to the vibration, was a cinch to do her nails.
customer_reviews.text: Once the dog got used to the vibration, was a cinch to do her nails.
customer_reviews.author: GLS

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!
customer_reviews.text: This worked great. It was a little louder than I expected but did the job perfectly. It was definitely worth the price I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy L Roark

customer_reviews.title: This thing works great on my 50 Lbs GSD/Collie mix
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great on my 50 Lbs GSD/Collie mix. It took a week to get her used to it with high reward treats. FIrst day, just touched her paws, next day touched her toes, next day her nails, By the 7th day I could sustain a grind, which is when I realized the thing gets the nail hot so best not to over do it. She's totally relaxed now and her nails are looking good.
customer_reviews.author: Paul J. Homlish III

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: seems to be pretty sturdy. I paid around 30 for it which is a good price. I paid about 20 for the last one I had; it was cordless and would run out of battery quickly and die out when pressure was applied. This one doesn't have any of those issues! :) I filed down my dog's nails about half the time that I used to. She is medium to large size dog about 45lbs so this worked well for her thicker nails.
customer_reviews.author: hthr

customer_reviews.title: Powerful enough, nice nail guard
customer_reviews.text: I spoke with a few dog groomers and they recommended a dremel power tool with plug in (not battery) so that it would have enough power. This has a really nice guard on it that a pro dremel wouldn’t have. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: AvidReader

customer_reviews.title: Ditch rechargeable nail grinders
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I was looking for when searching for a plug in nail grinder for my dog. It would take me days to complete all the paws on my 11 pound dog with the rechargeable trimmer. This gets the job done in one sitting. It can get warm after extended use but just don't abuse it and it should be fine.
customer_reviews.author: RAS

customer_reviews.title: doesn't work on medium sized nails
customer_reviews.text: This product did not shorten my dogs nails. It barely smoothed off the end ( after extended use) - and I need a grinder to take nail off- not just smooth it down. The previous reviews stated it worked well on larger dog breed nails- but I did not find that to be the case. I would not recommend this product unless you have a cat or a small dog with delicate nails.
customer_reviews.author: denver shopper

customer_reviews.title: Not hurting my dog
customer_reviews.text: The noise level is ok. I need to know how to use it or get my dog used to it.
customer_reviews.author: Tania

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, affordable
customer_reviews.text: The product is a very quiet.. I took it apart and used different grits of sandpaper with ease. I just used it on my shepherds nails.. worked like a charm! Its a steal! The only down side is there isn't a stow away bag.
customer_reviews.author: SageAF

customer_reviews.title: Actually bought this for me
customer_reviews.text: I have really dry heels so I bought this to keep them smooth - it works great on the calluses - and it's cheaper than the tools they use at the manicure studio
customer_reviews.author: L. Schiff

customer_reviews.title: Fur Baby
customer_reviews.text: I have had my nail grinder for 3 years, so to get these tools was amazing in itself. They are very good quality
customer_reviews.author: Sandy McKeehan

customer_reviews.title: not that pleased
customer_reviews.text: Was much louder than anticipated, dog was scared. Not too easy. sorry
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works good for dog nails
customer_reviews.text: Works great on dogs nail. Smells a bit, but that’s to be expected when filing nails at the speed of a dermal
customer_reviews.author: Diane B.

customer_reviews.title: Better than Nail clippers
customer_reviews.text: My dog hates getting her nails clipped. With this I don’t have to take her to Petco just to get her nails trimmed and I can easily do it at home. With the nail clippers she would always try to take her paw away from my hand and I would be scared to injure her since she wouldn’t stay still. With this she is calm even if she doesn’t enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: Angelica

customer_reviews.title: Great for older dogs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my elderly black lab. It works very well without the stress of taking him to the groomer for getting his nails cut.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: They are what they say
customer_reviews.text: Yes. Everything they advertise for this product is true and I like them just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Sentivan

customer_reviews.title: conair nail grinder
customer_reviews.text: Wish this had more power, only one speed, could not find what I wanted, so settled for this cause my dogs nails needed done badly, hopefully this will last
customer_reviews.author: virginia moews

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: After getting my dog used to this product I was able to get those nails filed down with ease. I wish it had different speeds but its not a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This product is better than the rechargeable ones because the power doesn't weaken. It is nice having a long cord with it. It doesn't make much noise either. My husband really likes this one compared to the others we've tried. We have a small dog and it works well for his nails.
customer_reviews.author: dinnee08

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Best nail trimmer I've used. Do not waste your time with the battery powered ones if your dog has thick nails. They battery dies too quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Gedney

customer_reviews.title: Makes Doing Dogs Nails MUCH Easier
customer_reviews.text: I don't do my dogs nails as often as I should, but this sure makes it easier. I learned from reading the reviews to not hold the nail on the file when its spinning for longer than a second or two. It can cause a burning pain for your pet. So I count every time I touch her nail and do each one for the same amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: DMT

customer_reviews.title: Superior product 👍👍👍!!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a plug-in nail grinder because I have a Lab who has toenails like a grizzly bear 👍 and this grinder worked wonders! It is very quiet,& easy to hold AND handle. It NEVER overheated and it took me over an hour just to do the front 2 paws 😎... I have used other cordless grinders...BUT this is SUPERIOR! I don't believe you'll be disappointed at all. I highly recommend this product. It also comes with extra little grinders and they are very easy to interchange.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Shelton

customer_reviews.title: Great job on hard nails
customer_reviews.text: My doggie has super hard nails, and this machine did excellent. It's a little slow, but does a very good/great job.
customer_reviews.author: Margee Morey

customer_reviews.title: Love it and so does my dog
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use. Does a great job. Very quiet
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Kay Depew

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Our dog hated getting her toe nails clipped. She now sits on our lap while we use the grinder on her nails. There is not a lot of noise while using. The cover of the grinder contains the dust from the nails.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Certainly not for big dogs
customer_reviews.text: One thing .....it is quiet but wouldn't buy unless you have ALL DAY to do your dogs nails. I have Chihuahuas and it just takes way too long especially with dogs that already don't like to get this done. I would look for something that has higher RPMs.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey B

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: This works great. Bought a rechargeable battery one last year and it was junk this one works great.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I like the ease of use and set up. It came with replacement heads. Dogs (including one skittish pupper) weren't afraid of the noise. Wish it was a bit more powerful, but great overall for the price.
customer_reviews.author: W B

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great dog don’t mind at all you can take the clear guard off like the long cord
customer_reviews.author: doreene walker

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: The unit has a sting motor and is very quit. The mini sanding drums wear out very quickly though
customer_reviews.author: David Martz

customer_reviews.title: Nice Dremmel...
customer_reviews.text: Nice Dremmel for the money. My dog is getting use to it. Files down the nails nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Jay

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd one! I bought this as a gift. Easy to use and my dogs prefer this over standard clippers
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: This might work well for small nails. The abrasive drums clog easily and cuts slow. Best to have a patient dog.
customer_reviews.author: HenryBoy

customer_reviews.title: Nail trimmer for dogs
customer_reviews.text: Please with the item, my dog isn't scared with the noise. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They really do work!!
customer_reviews.text: I loved them. I have tried a few highly recommend but, these by far are the best!!
customer_reviews.author: Kim Perez

customer_reviews.title: Quiet
customer_reviews.text: This is quiet and gentle and didn't scare my timid chihuahua.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

product_meta.title: ConairPRO Dog & Cat Professional Corded Nail Grinder
product_meta.description: Style:Corded Nail GrinderMake nail grooming a more pawsitive experience with the ConairPRO Professional Dog Nail Grinder. A safe and easy alternative to nail clipping, the grinder works by filing down your dog’s nails with a rotating attachment. Ideal for dogs of all sizes, it helps eliminate the risk of going too short, while keeping your dog’s nails at a comfortable length. Its quiet motor helps to put skittish dogs at ease, while the powerful and lightweight design gets the job done quickly.
feature_bullets: DOG NAIL GRINDER: Our professional-quality nail grinder is designed to safely groom the nails of dogs of all sizes. Comes with 2 interchangeable finishing stones 4 grinding bands.
EASY TO USE: This compact, lightweight dog nail grinder features a protective adjustable cover so can safely trim your dog's nails. It's powerful but quiet & comfortable for both you & your pet!
PET GROOMING SUPPLIES: Grooming your cat or dog is easy when you have the right tools. We make professional-quality brushes, shears, clippers, nail grinders & more to keep your pet looking great!
MADE TO LAST: ConairPRO Dog & Cat pet grooming tools are designed with high-quality materials for durability & performance. Our brushes, combs, shedding tools, nail grinders & more are made to last!

SHARE THE LOVE: From slicker brushes, shedding tools & shampoo brushes to full home grooming kits, ConairPRO Dog & Cat makes quality grooming supplies & products to help you take care of your cat or dog.
